instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Issues
threads.message: Ok, so I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> With No Magsafe light, PP3v42 is at 3.41V and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 8.18V and drawing .20A. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is at .50V. I am getting my 3.42V on pins 1 and 3. should I replace <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> first or is there other places to check first?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Issues
threads.message: Remove JTAG first. If no change, remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>. If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high, then bad <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> IC. If still low, bad SMC is likely

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Issues
threads.message:
Remove <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> before SMC; small chance for bad <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> still exists.
Let SMC to the last step.
BTW, be sure <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C5101</CAPACITOR> are good and test the board w/o trackpad flex.
In fact, post <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> voltages, if you doubt.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Issues
threads.message: ok. will do once I get the ok from the customer
